benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, audit=FULL, audit=MINIMAL, includedDeleted=true, combined params) validate successful 200 responses and content-type.
Empty Response: Scenario for bundle with no tags ensures empty JSON array handling (TC06).
Query Parameters: Good coverage of query parameter combinations and invalid values (includedDeleted true/false regression, invalid audit value, extra/unexpected params, injection attempt).

Error responses: 400 for invalid bundleId format (TC08) and invalid audit (TC09); 404 for non-existent bundle (TC07); 401 for missing/invalid authentication (TC12/TC13); 503/504 when API is unavailable (TC11).
Deleted-tag behavior: Covered both inclusion (TC02, TC05) and regression case to ensure deleted tags are excluded by default (TC17).
Audit information variations: FULL/MINIMAL tested (TC03/TC04) and backward compatibility/no-audit tested (TC18).
Non-functional/performance: Large dataset, concurrency, slow dependency and resource utilization scenarios are present (TC15, TC16, TC19, TC20).
Content validation: Response Content-Type check is included (TC01).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination (limit/offset/page markers) or verify behavior with paged results for very large tag sets.
Caching behavior / conditional requests: No scenarios check caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET (If-None-Match/304 responses).

Rate limiting / throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting responses (429) or throttling behavior under sustained high request rates; concurrent tests exist but do not assert rate-limit behavior.
Authorization (403 / role-based): Tests cover authentication (401) but not authorization scenarios (403) or role/permission-based access control.
Server error handling (5xx): No test explicitly asserting 500 Internal Server Error handling or graceful degradation for server-side failures (beyond API-unavailable 503/504).

Schema / field-level validation: Tests assert "Tag objects" presence but do not validate the Tag object schema (required fields, types, formats), nor do they validate the UUID format of returned IDs or audit field shapes in detail.
Invalid types for query params: No tests for incorrectly typed query parameter values beyond audit invalid enum and injection (e.g., includedDeleted=notABool).
HTTP method handling: No negative tests for unsupported methods (e.g., POST/PUT/DELETE on this endpoint) returning 405 Method Not Allowed.
Content negotiation / Accept header: No tests for Accept header handling or behavior when non-JSON Accept is requested.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: simulate large tag sets with limit/page parameters and verify correct slicing, next/prev links or headers, and behavior at boundaries (first/last page, empty page).
Add caching and conditional GET tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers on responses, and assert 304 Not Modified behavior with If-None-Match to reduce load.
Add explicit rate-limiting tests: generate sustained/high-frequency requests and assert 429 responses or configured throttling behavior; include test for retry-after header handling.
Add authorization/role-based tests: verify 403 responses for authenticated users lacking required permissions and test allowed vs forbidden roles.

Add server-error (5xx) handling tests: simulate database or service failures to assert 500 responses, well-formed error bodies, and that clients receive useful diagnostics without leaking sensitive data.
Add schema validation tests: assert Tag object fields, types and formats (e.g., id is UUID, audit fields shape for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE), and validate Content-Type and charset consistently.
Add tests for invalid query parameter types/values: e.g., includedDeleted=maybe or includedDeleted=123 and ensure 400/422 behavior as appropriate.
Add method-not-allowed tests: verify unsupported HTTP verbs return 405, with Allow header present.
Add content negotiation tests: verify behavior when Accept header is not application/json and ensure consistent Content-Type is returned or proper 406 if applicable.
